newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Sweden praises British Labour victory.
newsitem.headline: Sweden praises British Labour victory.

text.p: Swedish Prime Minister Goran Persson on Friday hailed Tony Blair's British election victory and said it put a final end to conservative doctrines launched by former premier Margaret Thatcher between 1979 and 1990.
"There is no doubt the Labour victory is a result of the devastating social consequences which the conservative Thatcher politics caused for large groups of British citizens.
Persson, who heads a minority social democratic government, said the victory was a boost for social democratic parties around Europe and would make jobs a key issue for the European Union.
"The Labour victory is strong inspiration for Social Democrats in all of Europe," Persson said in a statement.
"With a Labour government in Britain European Union cooperation in the struggle against unemployment will be affected in a positive and constructive direction," he said.
Persson said the victory sounded the death knell for conservative politicies.
"The victory shows that the British people would like to have a change and politics characterised by social responsibility for all people," Persson said.
Persson said he looked forward to meeting Blair at a meeting of European Socialist Parties (ESP) in the Swedish city of Malmo in June.
